result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick D Smith Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).
  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K. Watson.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Court reinstates bond.  Court imposes total sentence of 3 years 3 months WSP; 15 months initial confinement with credit for 195 days served; 2 years extended supervision with conditions.  Deft is eligible for CIP/SAP.  Deft to pay $250.00 DNA surcharge. Bond applied to costs and any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett. With Elizabeth/DDA Graveley and Atty Watson the STC of 6/11/15 at 2:30pm is rescheduled; as they are waiting for the WI Supreme Court to make a decision in the State v. Houghton case which should be out by mid-July; reset to 8/20/15 at 9am.

With Atty Watson and Elizabeth/ADA Graveley the STC of 4/9/15 at 9am is rescheduled; as the Wisconsin case they are waiting on, Houghton, interpreting the SCOTUS decision in Heien, is being argued on April 22; STC is reset to 6/11/15 at 2:30pm.
With Atty Watson and ADA Graveley the STC of 2/6/15 at 10am is rescheduled, as they are still waiting on the Supreme Court deciison; reset to 4/9/15 at 9am.
